context: Why does my razer taipan has only one laser sensor(8200dpi) while other taipan has the 4G "DUAL" sensor (2 laser sensor) ?

context: Does this mouse work on Mac? I would assume so, but it only mentions Windows operating systems in the description.
response: Yes it does now. Logitech released drivers for Mac a little while ago. Works fringe for me on my MBP.

context: How long does this mouse last? (Micro switches, scroll wheel, wheel click etc) I'm an intensive computer user/gamer. How many clicks is it rated at?
response: It's rated at 5 million clicks for each of the three top buttons and 1 million clicks for the two on the side. Though I'm also a heavy user and it's lasted me well beyond the expected lifetime. As with any technology, it'll last depending on your good/bad luck and how well you treat it.

context: Do the Naga drivers work with Windows 8.1
response: I didn't installed the naga specific drivers, but the plug'n'play one works fine, and simulates a number pressing on the side buttons.

context: could it be used on multiple computers?

context: Can this game be played entirely with Kinect? I saw a trailer advertising it as a Kinect game but all gameplay video show the player using a remote.
response: This game is played via controller only though one has the ability to control legions with voice commands via Kinect.

context: Is it worth it even IF I cannot use the streaming feature?
response: Yes! Absolutely! The NVidia Shield is a fine hand-held or table top console with fantastic support. I use it during my breaks at work, I plug it into my TV at home and sync a Bluetooth controller (Nyko or Mad Catz is what I use) and my 3 year old love to play Mario 64 like a home console.

context: So I'm guessing if the game is designed for higher accuracy WHEN aiming, this isn't going to help much. Is that right?
